Package graph

Class UndirectedGraph

  • java.lang.Object
    • graph.UndirectedGraph
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Graph
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    TSPGraph
    public class UndirectedGraph
extends java.lang.Object
implements Graph
    The UndirectGraph class implements the methods provided by the Graph interface. As the name of the class suggests it implements a graph whose edges are not directed, there is no distinction between inward or outward edges. Furthermore, it was established that the number of nodes of the graph remains constant for all times after an instance of this class is created. The size of the graph is kept in a final variable.

    For the reasons above mentioned, methods for inward or outward edges were labelled as @Depreciated. Similarly, no implementation was provided for Graph.removeVertex(...).

    The vertices of the graph are stored in a fixed-size array ordered by their index. This graph is implemented using adjacency lists and, therefore, the methods of Vertex are fully implemented.

    See Also:
    Node

        public Vertex findVertex​(int id)
                  throws VertexNotFound
        Description copied from interface: Graph
        Given the identifier of a vertex, such vertex is returned from a collection of all nodes belonging to the graph. If the vertex with such ID does not exist, an exception is thrown.
        Specified by:

        Returns:

        Throws:
        VertexNotFound - if the specified ID does not correspond to any vertex belonging to the graph

      • addEdge

        public boolean addEdge​(int id1,
                       int id2)
                throws SameVertex
        Description copied from interface: Graph
        Adds an edge between two vertices.

        It should be noticed that it is not allowed to have multiple edges connecting the same two nodes. Hence, before adding the new edge, it is verified whether the new edge already exists.

        Should the graph to be implemented to be directed, the order of the IDs given as parameters for this function must be fixed. Additionally, the implementation of Vertex should be done accordingly.

        Furthermore, as the weight of the edge is not specified, the weight of the new edge is equal to Graph.DEFAULT_EDGE_WEIGHT.

        Finally, no edge can be added between one vertex and itself.

        Specified by:
        addEdge in interface Graph
        Parameters:
        id1 - the identifier of the first vertex.
        id2 - the identifier of the second vertex.
        Returns:
        true if the an edge between two vertices specified by the two IDs is inserted successfully.
        Throws:
        SameVertex - if the new edge is to be inserted connecting a vertex to itself

      • addEdge

        public boolean addEdge​(int id1,
                       int id2,
                       int weight)
                throws SameVertex
        Description copied from interface: Graph
        Adds an edge between two vertices.

        It should be noticed that it is not allowed to have multiple edges connecting the same two nodes. Hence, before adding the new edge, it is verified whether the new edge already exists.

        Should the graph to be implemented to be directed, the order of the IDs given as parameters for this function must be fixed. Additionally, the implementation of Vertex should be done accordingly.

        Furthermore, the weight of new edge needs to be specified. This weight must be greater or equal to 1.

        Finally, no edge can be added between one vertex and itself.

        Specified by:
        addEdge in interface Graph
        Parameters:
        id1 - the identifier of the first vertex.
        id2 - the identifier of the second vertex.
        weight - the weight of the edge to be inserted between the two vertices.
        Returns:
        true if the an edge between two vertices specified by the two IDs is inserted successfully.
        Throws:
        SameVertex - if the new edge is to be inserted connecting a vertex to itself

public void addVertex()
        Deprecated.
        Description copied from interface: Graph
        Adds a new vertex to the graph. The assignment of the ID of this new vertex should be handled by the implementation of Vertex. The ID assigned to the new vertex should be the next number following the ID of the last node inserted.
        Specified by:
        addVertex in interface Graph

        Returns:
        true if an edge between the two specified vertices exists
        Throws:
        EdgeNotFound - if there is no edge linking the two vertices
        SameVertex - if the new edge is to be inserted connecting a vertex to itself
        VertexNotFound - if one of the vertices does not exist

      • removeEdge

        public boolean removeEdge​(int id1,
                          int id2)
        Description copied from interface: Graph
        Removes an edge between the two specified vertices.

        In this case, before removing the an edge, it is verified whether the this edge does indeed exist. Should this edge be inexistent and false is returned.

        Should the graph to be implemented to be directed, the order of the IDs given as parameters for this function must be fixed. Additionally, the implementation of Vertex should be done accordingly.

        Specified by:
        removeEdge in interface Graph
        Parameters:
        id1 - the identifier of the first vertex.
        id2 - the identifier of the second vertex.
        Returns:
        true if the specified edge is successfully removed.

      • removeVertex

        @Deprecated
public boolean removeVertex​(int id)
        Deprecated.
        Description copied from interface: Graph
        Removes the specified vertex from the graph. Additionally, all inward or outward edges connected to this vertex are also deleted.

        If the vertex labelled with the specified ID does not exist, the removal of the requested node is unsuccessful and, therefore, false is returned.

        After successfully removing a vertex, the value returned by Graph.getSize() is be decremented.

        Specified by:
        removeVertex in interface Graph
        Parameters:
        id - the ID of the vertex to be removed.
        Returns:
        true if the requested vertex is successfully removed from the graph

        Sets the weight of the edge linking the two specified nodes.

        Should the graph to be implemented to be directed, the order of the IDs given as parameters for this function must be fixed. Additionally, the implementation of Vertex should be done accordingly.

        If that edge does not exist, false is returned.

        Specified by:
        setEdgeWeight in interface Graph
        Parameters:
        id1 - the identifier of the first vertex.
        id2 - the identifier of the second vertex.
        weight - the weight to be assigned to the specified edge.
        Returns:
        true if the assignment of the weight of the requested edge is successful
